reviewText: I saw this movie back in the 80's and couldn't find it since.  A good movie with Tommy Lee Jones.

while not his best tommy lee jones is good as a nam vet who takes over for his dead friend and takes over central park to highlight how wrong vets are being done. the set up and the taking of the park are all handled very well and the story holds up very well when it could have easyly fallen apart. this was first made for hbo in the 80's and really needs to be on dvd.

This is one of the best Tommy Lee Jones movies. Also it is one of the best soundtracks performed by Tangerine Dream. I have the original soundtrack recording released by Silva America (SSD 1004) and it is great!. Two of my favorite tracks are 3. The Letter (Parts 1&2), and 6. Love Theme. They are very emotive and they always make me remember the movie. I relly hope they release this movie in DVD.
This is a great movie, one of Tommys best. I have been waiting for it to come to DVD for years. It was one of my favorite movies when i was a kid and would love to see it on DVD.
Graet movie, hope it to be in DVD format, it shows the other America that so many try to forget.
This is a great movie! I saw it when I was very young and it took me more than a decade to remember the name and now I realize there isn't a DVD release! I demand it!!!

This totally underrated movie was here and gone in what seemed like less than a minute and was lost in the heap of "Rambo"esque movies that were released, but this one was definitely better than average.
I can't remember the last time I saw a VHS copy of this film and it's been AGES since it was even on tv, but I'm still holding out hope that it will one day make it into DVD format.
If you haven't seen it and you like those 'ticked-off Viet Nam vet' movies, pick this one up...if you can find it.

This feature is the first film in which I realized TOMMY LEE JONES was going to be an actor of note.
Anyone who considers themselve's a fan of TLJ owe it to themselves to check this movie out.
I love this move, Tommy lee Jones is great in this movie. This is a movie that must come out for DVD in the near future. In the 80's it was HBO biggest movie.

This is a wonderful old Tommy Lee Jones movie. I remember this movie from when I was ten and will never forget the action scenes and acting. I definately recommend this movie if you like action movies or early Tommy Lee Jones stuff.
Great message film.

This movie deserves a Criterion Blu-Ray release. A quintessential, yet unsung, 1980s movie that perfectly captures the zeitgeist of the post-Vietnam War era. Yet, the movie's themes remain in sharp focus through today's lens, as it deals with such subjects as PTSD, suicide among military veterans, gun violence, acts of domestic terrorism, anti-establishment politics and feeling ineffectual in the world. "I'm just a guy, my life has been directed by other people, there are a lot of people like me, they don't have any control over their lives," Mitch (Tommy Lee Jones) says, and there are many today who feel the same way. What better way to ease these tumultuous emotions than to re-release this fine HBO movie on today's media platforms? It's time give "The Park Is Mine" its due!
Just a great old movie

The movie itself is well done with Tommy Lee Jones turning in his usual performance-with the usual action-you either like him or not. It has only been released on VHS to this point--HOWEVER, the Amazon HD streaming version is a 5 because of quality and WIDESCREEN.

Great movie

A Viet Nam Veteran decides to take control of Central Park with threats of force for a couple of days before Veteran's Day so people will be aware of those that fought and died for the country but have been forgotten.

He appears to have PTSD. The police are obviously concerned and aspire to use some tactics one of which includes sending in Soldiers of Fortune! A reporter gets into the park and spends time with the guy to get his story People on the street are interviewed and support his act of domestic terrorism. ends in an odd way.

I was somewhat sickened by it.

THANK YOU VETERANS!  Filmed in Canada!

This is not a high dollar movie, but it was pretty good. Still plays the veteran gets weird after the Vietnam War, but it does tell his side of the story some. Does not paint the picture that it was all the wars fault or the Vet's fault, but that Government will overstep its bounds sometimes, and also that when a man/s family abandons him, then things happen. I liked it more for the plan, weaponry, and shows the true nature of some politicians.
It is a B flick b tommy. Lee Jones is great.  This should be on DVD.  Nice shots of central park.

I watched this movie because of all the five star reviews, not knowing what to expect but hoping for a good movie. I thought the movie was unbelievable for one thing. I thought the acting was poor, seemed like the actors were having a hard time believing people would buy the plot. The movie seemed to lack substance meaning the characters were shallow and the plot too simple and lacking diversity. I was very disappointed and this reinforces the fact that even with a lot of great reviews a movie can still be terrible. This makes me wonder, who wrote all these five star reviews?

Tommy Lee Jones is one of my favorite bad ass actors. In this one he is bad ass, but on the good side of things.

Especially people in government who have no clue about the people they represent, they didn't care back than and the don't care now. Its the way government evades everything thats important to the people and have their own agenda's, so in the movie he holds the city hostage makes people think and thats a start unfortunately he had to do it at gun point. But sometimes that may be needed in the future.  Thanks Mike

I absolutley love this movie and I have been waiting for no less then 15 years for this movie to come out of moritorium, and finally it did, at least for download rental, but the fact that it is available is a plus, dvd disc is just around the corner, next.  The movie is quick and has few known cast memebers, however the plot is cool and the message is good, the acting well, this was initially a HBO special in the late 80's so it is fair,  I would definitley recommend this movie if you like guns, bullets and a short but to the point plot about veterans, don't expect Oscar acting, but it is enjoyable never the less.

I first saw this movie 1986 and loved it every since. The movie is a must see for all us veterans coming home from combat because even though it was a fictional it hit home on some of the issues some of us veterans are going through, I know I can relate to not being able to keep a job or not feeling wanted by family and loosing friends who I could relate to. The mainstream public has no clue what us veterans been through, neither do the powers that be!
